overview: Tawi (49), a squirrel in charge of the will of Sarmadin (45). Sarmadin is a retired saronèn artist who now sells homemade wine. He always told Tawi that if he died, he would bathe his body with wine and be accompanied by the beating of saronèn from the time he was bathed until he was taken to the grave. Sarmadin also asked that his sape sono' be slaughtered to celebrate his death. Sumrani (36), Sarmadin's wife, refused to carry out the will. Ke Dikram (52) who is a kyai also argues that this will is against tradition and shari'ah.
title: Basiyat
